newsitem.title: INDIA: Mixed demand at Calcutta tea auction.
newsitem.headline: Mixed demand at Calcutta tea auction.

text.p: Mixed demand prevailed at this week's Calcutta tea auction, traders said.
Auctions resumed after a week's gap because of holidays.
On offer were 84,620 packages, including 6,231 packages of Darjeeling tea.

In CTC variety, better liquoring sorts were barely steady while the remainder were easier with quality. In orthodox variety, clean whole leaf were lower by two to three rupees while brokens and fannings were easier by one to two rupees.
In dust variety, good liquoring Assams and clean well made Dooars were firm. The rest were lower in line with quality.
